page.title: 13Bus Services
page.content: The rundown of public transport over recent years is of great concern. Many people have solved this by their own form of transport, but for those who cannot afford this or cannot drive, life can be difficult, especially for the elderly and young people. Although the survey statistics show 7 buses running all year round, only one of these is a daily service, running from Llanrwst to Llandudno through Trefriw hourly. The other buses run to Llanrwst only on market or Fair day ie once a week from outlying districts. School children have their own services and where only a few children live in an isolated area, a taxi service is used. Fares, though subsidised, are high, and visits to the doctor, dentist and chiropodist are made expensive for old people for whom there are no concessionary fares.
